message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

The paper is about applying convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to Chinese word segmentation (CWS), which is a task in natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes an approach to integrate word embeddings, which are widely used in NLP, into the CNN model. This suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper evaluates the model on two benchmark datasets, which involves information retrieval (IR) techniques. Therefore, cs.IR is also a possible sub-category.
